subject: Add support for vendor specific FruDbusLookup
commitMessage:
Add support for vendor specific FruDbusLookup

In the current state, a vendor could not define the FRU's
that he wants to send to the host.

This commit adds a fru_master.json that can be used while
building the master , and the json would be replaced with
fru_master.json from the oem/<vendor>/configurations
directory when compiling for oem's.

Tested By:

IBM machine test :
1. meson build -Doem-ibm=enabled -Dprefix=<>
2. ninja -C build && ninja install
3. in the prefix directory we should see the json file
   from the oem/ibm/configurations folder

Non IBM machine test :
1. meson build -Doem-ibm=disabled -Dprefix=<>
2. ninja -C build && ninja install
3. in the prefix directory we should see the json file
   from the pldm/configurations folder.

Runtime test:
1. on an IBM machine make sure the pldm builds the fru record
   table.

Signed-off-by: Manojkiran Eda <manojkiran.eda@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id3c2746c51a1f99f2038b2af48137133e9d0b405

Done

What code would catch this? I think InternalFailure is used less in the project.

Want daemon to crash and not continue or still continue?

My intent was to halt the execution of pldm when the config file was wrong by throwing xyz::openbmc_project::Common::Error::InternalFailure . It does not make sense to continue as the bmc fru record table & entity association PDR is the basis for normalization.we can go into all sorts of trouble in the later stages of booting. when this map is null.
Based on this https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/anti-patterns.md#handling-unexpected-error-codes-and-exceptions, should we just abort here?

yes, the pldm application already aborts here and core dumps after throwing xyz::openbmc_project::Common::Error::InternalFailure.

Error case traces : 

Parsing FRU Dbus Lookup Map config file failed, FILE=/usr/share/pldm/fru_master.json, terminate called after throwing an instance of 'sdbusplus::xyz::openbmc_project::Common::Error::InternalFailure'
  what():  xyz.openbmc_project.Common.Error.InternalFailure: The operation failed internally.

[1]+  Aborted                 (core dumped) /tmp/pldmd --verbose=1
Yup, so instead of InternalFailure, just use std::abort?
Done
Do we have a new Vendor entry already?

I did not get your statement, so the whole point in adding this support was to stop sending certain information that host already knows.

for example, on IBM systems processors & dimm information are already available for a host(hostboot), so there is not point in sending them from bmc.

with eariler design, as it was generic code, we were forced to send cpu & dimm info even when we did not want it.
Got it, so it was getting finer control on the FRU records sent.

Also, this would be useful in cases where we dont have specific entities in the spec.For example : we dont have a pcie slot rather we have a generic slot ,so vendors can choose to pick nvme slot in that placeholder or a pcie slot..and not clutter the community code.
Ack
